alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 7:19PM EST until February 23 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FREEZING RAIN CONTINUES THIS EVENING... .Rain continues to fall over the freezing surface over the Advisory area this evening with greatest ice accretion expected for interior portions of Maine. A transition to rain will occur south to north late in the evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations from a trace up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening commute.
info.instruction: Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511. org
